fees.reducedCommissionDetails: Free and paid components available. 30% commission on paid.

seo.metaTitle: Adalo Component Marketplace - No-Code App Components
seo.metaDescription: Extend Adalo with 50+ components. No-code app builder marketplace.

content:
## Overview

Adalo Component Marketplace is the official marketplace for Adalo no-code app builder. With 50+ components and templates for mobile and web apps, it extends Adalo's drag-and-drop platform for entrepreneurs, startups, and businesses building apps without code.

## Key Statistics

- **50+ components** (estimated)
- Component Marketplace 2.0 launched March 2022
- 25+ new components at 2.0 launch
- Growing third-party ecosystem

## Marketplace 2.0 (2022)

Launched with over 25 new components to make Adalo apps:
- Slicker design
- Faster performance
- Better functionality

## Component Types

### UI Components
- Navigation elements
- Forms and inputs
- Media displays
- Charts and graphs

### Functionality
- QR Code Generator (8,000+ installations)
- Payment integrations
- Social features
- Data connections

## Feature Templates

Pre-built feature templates include:
- Component selection
- Styling applied
- Database setup
- Data pre-loaded
- Screens linked
- Ready to customize

Templates are designed to work together, allowing quick assembly of complete apps.

## Third-Party Marketplaces

Beyond the official marketplace:
- **Adalomatic** - Third-party components
- **UIXX** - Themes and data templates
- **itsmi.store** - Additional components

## Development

Build components using:
- JavaScript/React Native
- Adalo component SDK
- Component guidelines
- Developer documentation

## Recent Updates (2024)

- Adalomatic moved components to official marketplace
- Continued component additions
- Usage tracking improvements

seo.metaDescription: Publish plugins for Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro. 5,000+ extensions available.

content:
## Overview

Adobe Exchange is the official marketplace for Adobe Creative Cloud and Experience Cloud plugins and extensions. It serves millions of creative professionals with add-ons for Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro, and enterprise products.

## Marketplace Structure

### Creative Cloud Marketplace
Desktop app Plugin Marketplace and Exchange web surface showcase the same plugins.

### Experience Cloud Apps
Enterprise integrations for Adobe Workfront, Analytics, and other Experience Cloud products.

## Plugin Formats

- **UXP**: Modern JavaScript-based plugin format
- **ZXP/CEP**: Legacy ExtendScript-based plugins
- **MXI**: Older installation packages

## Supported Applications

- Photoshop
- Illustrator
- Premiere Pro
- After Effects
- InDesign
- XD
- Lightroom
- Experience Cloud products

## Monetization Features

- FastSpring e-commerce platform
- Merchant of Record for EU
- VAT collection and remittance
- Free or paid perpetual products
- Subscription support

## Development

Build plugins using:
- Developer Distribution portal
- UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform)
- CEP (Common Extensibility Platform)
- Adobe APIs and SDKs

content:
## Overview

Amazon Alexa Skills Store launched in 2015 alongside the Amazon Echo and has grown to over 100,000 skills globally. It powers voice interactions on Echo devices, Fire TV, third-party speakers, and 100,000+ compatible smart home devices.

## Key Statistics

- **100,000+ skills** available globally
- **100,000+ smart home devices** compatible
- **12+ countries** with localized stores
- Alexa Developer Rewards for top skills

## Skill Categories

- Smart home control
- Games & trivia
- Music & audio
- News & information
- Productivity
- Shopping
- Health & fitness
- Education

## Monetization Options

### In-Skill Purchases
- One-time purchases
- Consumables
- Subscriptions
- 70% revenue share to developers

### Alexa Developer Rewards
Amazon pays bonuses for highly-engaged skills based on usage metrics.

## Development

Build skills using:
- Alexa Skills Kit (ASK)
- Node.js, Python, or Java SDKs
- Alexa-hosted (free backend)
- Voice design best practices

Fire OS optimization may require extra work
content:
## Overview

Amazon Appstore is Amazon's proprietary app store for Android devices and Amazon's Fire product line. It offers developers access to millions of customers across Amazon's device ecosystem.

## Unique Features

### Amazon Coins
A virtual currency that customers can use to purchase apps and in-app items at a discount, while developers still receive full revenue.

### Merch by Amazon Integration
Developers can integrate merchandise sales directly within their apps.

### Fire Device Optimization
Apps can be optimized for Fire tablets, Fire TV, and Echo Show devices for enhanced user experiences.

name: Apple App Store
tagline: The official app marketplace for iOS, iPadOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS
description: The Apple App Store is Apple's official digital distribution platform for applications on iOS, iPadOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS. Known for its strict quality standards and curated approach, it serves over a billion active devices worldwide.

commissionTiers.conditions: Developers earning less than $1M annually
For earnings above $1M per year

fees.reducedCommissionDetails: The App Store Small Business Program offers 15% commission for developers earning less than $1M per year. Auto-renewable subscriptions also qualify for 15% after the first year.

submission.guidelinesSummary: Apps must meet Apple's quality standards including design guidelines, privacy requirements, and content policies. Human review ensures compliance.
submission.appealsProcess: Developers can appeal through App Store Connect or request a phone call with the App Review team

seo.metaTitle: Apple App Store - iOS & macOS App Distribution
seo.metaDescription: Publish your iOS and macOS apps on the Apple App Store. Learn about developer fees, App Store review process, and distribution options.

pros: Premium user base with higher spending power
Strict quality control ensures high-quality apps
cons: Strict guidelines can limit app functionality
content:
## Overview

The Apple App Store, launched on July 10, 2008, revolutionized mobile app distribution. It remains the exclusive way to distribute apps to iOS, iPadOS, macOS (for Mac App Store apps), watchOS, and tvOS devices for most users.

## Key Features for Developers

### App Store Connect
Apple's developer portal provides:
- App analytics and sales reports
- TestFlight for beta testing
- App Store optimization tools
- Financial reports and tax documentation
- Team management and role assignments

### TestFlight
Apple's official beta testing platform allows:
- Up to 10,000 external testers
- Up to 100 internal testers
- 90-day testing period per build
- Automatic build distribution

### App Clips
Light-weight app experiences (under 15MB) that can be accessed without full app installation.

name: Aptoide
description: Aptoide is an alternative Android app store that operates as an open marketplace. It allows developers to create their own stores and distribute apps outside of Google Play.

commissionTiers.conditions: For in-app purchases and app sales

submission.guidelinesSummary: Aptoide has flexible submission guidelines. Apps are scanned for malware but content restrictions are more relaxed than Google Play.

seo.metaDescription: Distribute your Android apps on Aptoide. Free registration, 25% commission, and reach 300M+ users worldwide.

cons: Lower trust perception than official stores
content:
## Overview

Aptoide is one of the oldest and largest alternative Android app stores. Its unique distributed model allows developers and companies to create their own app stores within the Aptoide ecosystem.

## Unique Features

### Custom Stores
Developers can create branded stores with their own apps, allowing direct distribution to users.

### AppCoins Protocol
Aptoide developed AppCoins, a blockchain-based payment protocol for app transactions.

name: Atlassian Marketplace
tagline: Apps for Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and more
description: Atlassian Marketplace is the official app store for Atlassian products including Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and Trello. With over 6,000 apps and millions of users, it's essential for reaching teams using Atlassian tools.

commissionTiers.conditions: 0% revenue share until reaching $1M lifetime Forge revenue
After $1M lifetime revenue (increasing to 17% by Oct 2026)
Current rate (increasing to 25% by Oct 2026)

fees.reducedCommissionDetails: Forge apps get 0% revenue share until $1M lifetime revenue. Starting April 2026, Connect apps will increase to 20% then 25%, while Forge remains lower. New Forge apps get 95% of revenue in first year.

submission.guidelinesSummary: Apps must pass security review and meet Atlassian's technical and UX guidelines. Forge apps are encouraged for cloud products.

seo.metaTitle: Atlassian Marketplace - Apps for Jira, Confluence & More
seo.metaDescription: Publish your Atlassian apps with 0% commission on first $1M for Forge apps. Reach millions of Jira and Confluence users.

pros: 0% commission on first $1M lifetime for Forge apps
Multiple deployment options (Cloud, Server, Data Center)
cons: Revenue share increasing for Connect apps (to 25% by Oct 2026)
Forge migration required for best rates
content:
## Overview

Atlassian Marketplace launched in 2012 and has grown to over 6,000 apps serving millions of users of Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and Trello.

## Platform Options

### Forge (Recommended)
- Serverless app platform
- 0% revenue share until $1M lifetime
- Required for best commission rates

### Connect
- Traditional cloud app framework
- Currently 15%, increasing to 25% by October 2026
- More flexibility but higher fees

## Revenue Share Changes (2026)

| Date | Forge Apps | Connect Apps |
|------|------------|--------------|
| Current | 15% | 15% |
| April 2026 | 16% | 20% |
| October 2026 | 17% | 25% |

**Note:** Forge apps get 0% until reaching $1M lifetime revenue across all Forge apps.

name: AWS Marketplace
description: AWS Marketplace is Amazon's digital catalog for software, data, and services that run on AWS. With thousands of ISV products and simplified procurement, it's essential for reaching enterprise cloud customers.

commissionTiers.conditions: Public SaaS offers and AWS Data Exchange products
AMI, container, and ML image offers
Private offers $1M-$10M (scales down to 1.5% for larger deals)

fees.reducedCommissionDetails: SaaS sellers keep 97-98.5% of revenue. Private offers have tiered rates: 3% for <$1M, 2% for $1-10M, 1.5% for renewals. South Korea adds +1% regional fee. No fees for listing - only on transactions.

submission.guidelinesSummary: Products must meet AWS technical requirements and security standards. SaaS products require integration with AWS Marketplace Metering Service.

seo.metaDescription: Sell your cloud software on AWS Marketplace with only 3% commission for SaaS. Reach millions of AWS enterprise customers.

pros: Private offer support for enterprise deals
content:
## Overview

AWS Marketplace launched in 2012 and has grown to host over 14,000 software products from thousands of ISVs. It's the leading cloud marketplace for enterprise software procurement.

## Fee Structure (Updated January 2024)

| Product Type | Listing Fee |
|--------------|-------------|
| SaaS / Data Exchange | 3% |
| Server-based (AMI, containers) | 20% |
| Private offers <$1M | 3% |
| Private offers $1M-$10M | 2% |
| Private offers >$10M | 1.5% |
| Renewals | 1.5% |

**Note:** Fees only apply on transactions. No upfront listing fees.

## Key Features

### Private Offers
- Custom pricing for enterprise deals
- Negotiable terms and conditions
- Lower fees for larger deals

### AWS Consumption Integration
- Customers can apply existing AWS commitments
- Simplified procurement through AWS billing

name: Azure Marketplace
description: Azure Marketplace is Microsoft's digital storefront for cloud software, services, and solutions that integrate with Azure. With a flat 3% transaction fee, ISVs retain 97% of revenue while reaching Microsoft's vast enterprise customer base.

commissionTiers.conditions: Flat 3% on all transactable offers (SaaS, VMs, containers)

fees.reducedCommissionDetails: Microsoft charges a flat 3% transaction fee on all Azure Marketplace sales. This is significantly lower than most marketplaces. ISVs keep approximately 97% of revenue. Additional rebates available through the Marketplace Transact and Grow program.

submission.guidelinesSummary: Products must meet Microsoft's technical requirements and certification standards. Publishing through Partner Center.

seo.metaTitle: Azure Marketplace - Microsoft Cloud Software Marketplace
seo.metaDescription: Sell your cloud software on Azure Marketplace with only 3% transaction fee. Reach Microsoft's enterprise customers.

pros: Only 3% transaction fee (lowest major cloud marketplace)
Rebates through Transact and Grow program
cons: Enterprise focus may not suit all products
content:
## Overview

Azure Marketplace is part of Microsoft's commercial marketplace, alongside AppSource for business applications. It offers ISVs access to Microsoft's enterprise customers with one of the lowest transaction fees in the industry.

## Fee Structure

- **Flat 3% transaction fee** on all sales
- No upfront listing fees
- ISVs keep approximately 97% of revenue
- Microsoft handles tax collection and remittance

## ISV Incentive Programs (FY25)

### Marketplace Transact and Grow
- Revenue tracked by Publisher ID across all listings
- $20,000 rebate at $100K eligible Azure Consumed Revenue (ACR)
- $50,000 additional rebate at $4M eligible ACR

## Integration Benefits

- Customers can use existing Azure commitments
- Simplified procurement through Azure billing
- Enterprise Agreement support
- Co-sell opportunities with Microsoft sellers

- Built on ERNIE (Enhanced Representation through kNowledge IntEgration)
- First major Chinese LLM to launch publicly
- Integrated across Baidu products

### Capabilities
- Conversational AI
- Content generation
- Code assistance
- Image generation
- Document analysis

## Plugin Categories

### Office Productivity
- PPT generation
- Document creation
- Spreadsheet automation
- Meeting summaries
- Email drafting

### Multimodal Content
- Image generation
- Audio/video extraction
- Text-to-speech
- Image understanding
- Video summarization

### Mind Mapping
- Automatic mind map creation
- Concept visualization
- Brainstorming tools
- Knowledge organization

### Professional Queries
- Academic research
- Legal information
- Medical knowledge
- Financial data
- Industry reports

## Plugin Development

### Requirements
- Baidu developer account
- Chinese business registration (for commercial)
- API endpoint hosting
- Compliance documentation

### Technical Stack
- ERNIE API integration
- Wenxin Workshop SDK
- RESTful API design
- OAuth authentication

## Wenxin Workshop

Baidu's AI development platform:
- Model fine-tuning
- Prompt engineering
- Plugin development
- API management
- Usage analytics

## User Experience

### Accessing Plugins
1. Open ERNIE Bot (yiyan.baidu.com)
2. Navigate to plugin marketplace
3. Browse or search for plugins
4. Enable desired plugins
5. Use plugins via natural language

### Example Commands
- "Generate a PPT about renewable energy"
- "Create a mind map of project management"
- "Extract audio from this video"
- "Summarize this legal document"

## Ecosystem Integration

ERNIE Bot integrates with:
- Baidu Search
- Baidu Maps
- Baidu Cloud
- Baidu Docs
- Other Baidu services

## Regulatory Compliance

Plugins must comply with:
- Chinese cybersecurity laws
- Content moderation requirements
- Data localization rules
- AI ethics guidelines

## Market Position

ERNIE Bot competes with:
- Alibaba Tongyi Qianwen
- Tencent Hunyuan
- ByteDance Doubao
- Zhipu ChatGLM

## Getting Started

1. Register for Baidu developer account
2. Apply for Wenxin Workshop access
3. Review plugin development documentation
4. Build and test your plugin
5. Submit for review
6. Launch on the plugin store

pros: Works with Claude.ai and Claude Code
content:
## Overview

The Claude MCP Marketplace encompasses the ecosystem of Model Context Protocol servers and plugins that extend Claude's capabilities. MCP is an open protocol introduced by Anthropic that standardizes how LLMs communicate with external tools, databases, and services.

## Model Context Protocol (MCP)

### What is MCP?
MCP provides a standardized way for AI models to:
- Access external data sources
- Execute actions on third-party services
- Maintain persistent state
- Interact with local and remote tools

### Protocol Benefits
- **Standardization**: One protocol for all integrations
- **Security**: Controlled access to external resources
- **Flexibility**: Works across different AI platforms
- **Extensibility**: Easy to add new capabilities

## MCP Server Categories

### Official (Anthropic)
- File system access
- Git operations
- Database connections
- Web browsing

### Search & Web
- Web scraping tools
- Search engine integrations
- API connectors

### Communication
- Slack integrations
- Email access
- Messaging platforms

### Productivity
- Calendar access
- Task management
- Document handling

### Development
- Code analysis
- Testing tools
- Deployment automation

### Database
- PostgreSQL, MySQL connections
- Vector databases
- Data warehouses

## Claude Artifacts Integration

Artifacts can now connect to MCP:
- Interactive applications with external service access
- Read/write to tools like Asana, Google Calendar, Slack
- Persistent storage across sessions
- Personal or shared storage options

## MCP Registries & Directories

### Official Registry
- registry.modelcontextprotocol.io
- Authoritative metadata repository
- Currently in preview

### Community Directories
- **MCP.so**: Largest collection
- **mcpservers.org**: Curated directory
- **mcpmarket.com**: Discovery marketplace
- **Cline MCP Marketplace**: One-click installs

## Claude Code Plugins

Claude Code 2.0.13 introduced plugin marketplace:
- Package slash commands
- Bundle specialized agents
- Include MCP servers
- Single-command installation

### Official Plugin Repository
- github.com/anthropics/claude-plugins-official
- Curated high-quality plugins
- Anthropic-vetted for trust

## Building MCP Servers

### TypeScript SDK
```typescript
import { Server } from "@modelcontextprotocol/sdk/server";

const server = new Server({
  name: "my-mcp-server",
  version: "1.0.0"
});

// Define tools and resources
```

### Python SDK
```python
from mcp import Server

server = Server("my-mcp-server")

# Define tools and resources
```

## Security Considerations

- Trust plugins before installing
- MCP servers run with elevated permissions
- Anthropic does not control third-party servers
- Review source code when possible
- Use official/verified sources

content:
## Overview

Coze is ByteDance's AI bot development platform, launched in early 2024 as the company's answer to OpenAI's GPTs. It provides a comprehensive no-code environment for building, deploying, and sharing AI chatbots across multiple platforms.

## Key Features

### Bot Builder
The drag-and-drop interface enables:
- Natural language bot configuration
- Visual workflow design
- Plugin integration
- Knowledge base management

### 60+ Built-in Plugins
Plugins cover various use cases:
- Information reading and web search
- Travel planning
- Productivity tools (PPT generation, mind maps)
- Image understanding
- Audio/video processing
- API integrations

### Multi-Channel Deployment
Deploy bots to:
- Discord
- Telegram
- Slack
- Facebook Messenger
- Reddit
- Line
- WhatsApp (coming)

## Technical Architecture

### Doubao Model
Coze runs on ByteDance's in-house Doubao large language model, with support for:
- Text generation
- Image understanding
- Code generation
- Multimodal interactions

### MCP Support
Coze supports the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for:
- Integration with Lark (Feishu)

## Deployment Options

- Managed hosting
- Free tier: 200 GPT-4 calls
- Sandbox environment
- Easy setup

### Self-Hosted
- Docker deployment
- Full control
- Data privacy
- Custom infrastructure

## Building for Dify

### Plugin Development
```python
from dify_plugin import Plugin

class MyPlugin(Plugin):
    def execute(self, inputs):
        # Plugin logic here
        return outputs
```

### Contribution Process
1. Fork the repository
2. Develop your plugin
3. Follow coding standards

5. Community review

## Open Source

content:
## Overview

Firefox Add-ons (addons.mozilla.org, or AMO) is Mozilla's official marketplace for Firefox browser extensions, themes, and add-ons. With over 25,000 extensions and no fees or commissions, it's one of the most developer-friendly browser extension platforms.

## Key Statistics

- **25,000+ extensions** available
- **40% of Firefox users** have at least one add-on installed
- **1,000+ Android extensions** (launched December 2023, reached 1,000 by May 2024)
- Usage varies by country: 19% in India, 60% in Russia

## WebExtensions API

Firefox uses the WebExtensions API, which is largely compatible with Chrome:
- Similar manifest structure
- Most Chrome extensions can be ported
- Some Firefox-specific APIs available
- No Manifest V3 restrictions (more developer freedom)

## Firefox for Android

Mozilla launched an open ecosystem for Android extensions in December 2023:
- Started with 400+ extensions
- Grew to 1,000+ by May 2024

description: GitHub Copilot Extensions marketplace allows developers to extend GitHub Copilot's capabilities with third-party tools, services, and data sources. Build extensions that integrate directly into the Copilot chat experience.

commissionTiers.conditions: GitHub account required

submission.guidelinesSummary: Extensions must comply with GitHub's acceptable use policies and provide value to Copilot users.

seo.metaTitle: GitHub Copilot Extensions - AI Development Tool Marketplace
seo.metaDescription: Build and publish extensions for GitHub Copilot. Integrate third-party tools and services into the AI coding assistant used by millions of developers.

content:
## Overview

GitHub Copilot Extensions is a marketplace within GitHub Marketplace specifically for apps that extend GitHub Copilot's capabilities. These extensions integrate directly into Copilot Chat, allowing developers to access third-party tools and services without leaving their workflow.

## Extension Capabilities

### Chat Integration
Extensions can:
- Respond to @mentions in Copilot Chat
- Access conversation context
- Provide specialized assistance
- Connect to external services

### Tool Integration
- Pull in external data sources
- Execute actions on third-party platforms
- Automate development workflows
- Enhance code suggestions

## Available Extensions

Popular extension categories:
- **Documentation**: API docs, library references
- **CI/CD**: Build tools, deployment services
- **Security**: Vulnerability scanning, code analysis
- **Testing**: Test generation, coverage tools
- **Database**: Query assistance, schema management
- **Monitoring**: Log analysis, performance tools

## Building Extensions

### Architecture
Extensions are built as:
- GitHub Apps with Copilot capabilities
- Webhook endpoints that respond to Copilot requests
- OAuth-authenticated services

### Development Process
1. Create a GitHub App
2. Enable Copilot extension features
3. Implement webhook handlers
4. Handle authentication
5. Submit to marketplace

### SDK Support
- Official SDKs for major languages
- Sample extension templates
- Local development tools
- Testing utilities

## User Experience

When users have an extension installed:
1. Mention the extension in Copilot Chat: `@extension-name`
2. Ask questions or request actions
3. Extension responds with contextual help
4. Actions execute on connected services

## Requirements

### For Developers
- GitHub account
- GitHub App registration
- Webhook endpoint hosting
- API documentation

### For Users
- GitHub Copilot subscription
- Extension installation permission
- GitHub account

## Best Practices

- Provide clear, focused functionality
- Handle errors gracefully
- Respect rate limits
- Document capabilities thoroughly
- Support common use cases

content:
## Overview

Gemini Gems are custom AI experts that users can create within Google's Gemini AI platform. Unveiled at Google I/O in August 2024, Gems allow users to build personalized assistants tailored to specific tasks, from brainstorming partners to coding helpers.

## Key Features

### Workspace Integration
Gems are deeply integrated with Google Workspace:
- Available in Docs, Sheets, Slides side panels
- Accessible from Gmail and Google Drive
- Seamless context sharing across apps

### Gem Creation
Users can create Gems by:
- Selecting from premade templates (Learning Coach, Brainstormer, Career Guide, Writing Editor, Coding Partner)
- Creating custom Gems with natural language instructions
- Defining personality, expertise, and response style

### Sharing Capabilities
As of September 2025, Gems support sharing via:
- Drive-style permissions (Viewer or Editor)
- Direct link sharing
- Organization-wide distribution for Workspace accounts

## Super Gems (Coming Soon)

Google is developing "Super Gems" which will:
- Function as pre-built AI workflows
- Allow visual creation of AI apps without coding
- Enable publishing to a public Super Gems Marketplace
- Support monetization for creators

## Premade Gems

Google provides several premade Gems:
- **Learning Coach**: Personalized tutoring and study assistance
- **Brainstormer**: Creative ideation and problem-solving
- **Career Guide**: Professional development and job search help
- **Writing Editor**: Content review and improvement
- **Coding Partner**: Programming assistance and debugging

## Requirements

- Gemini Advanced, Business, or Enterprise subscription
- Google account
- Available in 180+ countries

Google Play supports Android App Bundles (AAB), allowing developers to reduce app size by up to 50% through optimized delivery.

### Play Console

- Release management with staged rollouts
- Pre-launch reports with automated testing
- User acquisition reports and statistics
- Revenue and financial reports
- Crash reporting and ANR analysis

- Open testing (anyone can join)
- Pre-registration for upcoming apps

content:
## Overview

Hugging Face Spaces is the world's largest directory of AI applications, hosting over 500,000 apps that showcase everything from text generation to 3D modeling. It serves as both a hosting platform for ML demos and a discovery engine for exploring AI capabilities.

## Space Types

### Gradio Spaces
- Python-based ML interface library
- Easy-to-build interactive UIs
- Built-in components for common ML tasks
- Automatic API generation

### Streamlit Spaces
- Python apps with rich widgets
- Data visualization focus
- Rapid prototyping
- Dashboard-style interfaces

### Docker Spaces
- Full container flexibility
- Any programming language
- Custom dependencies
- Complex application architectures

### Static Spaces
- HTML/CSS/JavaScript
- Simple hosting
- Fast loading
- No backend required

## AI App Categories

### Image Generation
- Text-to-image models
- Image editing tools
- Style transfer
- Upscaling and enhancement

### Text Generation
- Chatbots and assistants
- Content creation
- Translation
- Summarization

### Audio & Music
- Text-to-speech
- Music generation
- Voice cloning
- Audio processing

### Video
- Text-to-video
- Video editing
- Frame interpolation
- Video analysis

### 3D & Vision
- 3D generation
- Object detection
- Segmentation
- Depth estimation

### Code & Development
- Code generation
- Code explanation
- Debugging assistants
- Documentation tools

## Compute Options

### Free Tier
- 2 vCPU
- 16GB RAM
- CPU-only execution
- Basic for demos

### Paid Upgrades
- **GPU**: A10G, A100, T4, L4
- **ZeroGPU**: Shared GPU for sporadic use
- **CPU Upgrade**: More RAM and cores
- **Persistent Storage**: For stateful apps

## Model Hub Integration

Spaces connect directly to Hugging Face Hub:
- 400,000+ pre-trained models
- 100,000+ datasets
- One-line model loading
- Automatic caching

## Building a Space

1. Create Space (Gradio, Streamlit, or Docker)
2. Write your application code
3. Define requirements.txt
4. Push to Hugging Face
5. Space builds and deploys automatically

### Example Gradio Space
```python
import gradio as gr

def greet(name):
    return f"Hello {name}!"

demo = gr.Interface(fn=greet, inputs="text", outputs="text")
demo.launch()
```

## Discovery Features

- Trending Spaces
- Category browsing
- Community Collections
- Organization Spaces
- Search functionality
- Likes and bookmarks

## Use Cases

- **Research**: Share paper demos
- **Prototyping**: Test model ideas
- **Education**: Interactive tutorials
- **Portfolio**: Showcase ML skills
- **Business**: Product demos

content:
## Overview

The Microsoft 365 Copilot Store is the official marketplace for extending Microsoft's AI-powered productivity assistant. Plugins and agents appear in Teams, Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and the dedicated Agent Store within Microsoft 365 Copilot.

## Extensibility Options

### Agents
Custom AI agents built with:
- **Copilot Studio**: No-code agent builder
- **Azure AI Foundry**: Advanced AI development
- **Visual Studio Code**: Full code control

### API Plugins
Connect Copilot to external services:
- REST API integrations
- OpenAPI specification support
- Authentication handling

### Copilot Connectors
Bring external data into Copilot:
- Data source connections
- Microsoft Graph integration
- Enterprise data access

## Development Tools

### Microsoft 365 Agents SDK
- Core agent components
- Enterprise-grade publishing
- Multi-channel deployment (Teams, web, 15+ channels)

### Teams Toolkit
- Visual Studio Code extension
- Quick plugin scaffolding
- Local debugging support

### Copilot Studio
- No-code/low-code builder
- Visual conversation designer
- Built-in testing

## Publishing Process

1. **Develop**: Build using SDK, Teams Toolkit, or Copilot Studio
2. **Test**: Local testing and validation
3. **Submit**: Upload to Microsoft Partner Center
4. **Certify**: Pass security and policy review
5. **Publish**: Deploy to marketplace
6. **Enable**: IT admins enable for organization

## Enterprise Features

- **Admin Controls**: IT admins control which plugins users can access
- **Security**: Enterprise-grade security certification
- **Compliance**: Meet organizational compliance requirements
- **Governance**: Audit logs and usage tracking

## Monetization

Sell through Microsoft Commercial Marketplace:
- Per-seat licensing
- Usage-based pricing
- Subscription models
- Enterprise agreements

## App Types Supported

Native Windows apps that can run across Windows 10/11 devices.

Traditional Windows desktop applications packaged in MSIX format.

Web apps that can be installed and run like native apps.

### Android Apps (via WSA)
Select Android apps can run on Windows 11 through Windows Subsystem for Android.

High competition with millions of GPTs
content:
## Overview

The OpenAI GPT Store launched in January 2024 as the official marketplace for custom GPTs built on ChatGPT. It allows anyone with a ChatGPT Plus, Team, or Enterprise subscription to create specialized AI assistants without coding and share them with the world.

## Key Features for Creators

### GPT Builder
The no-code GPT Builder allows creators to:
- Define custom instructions and personality
- Upload knowledge files (PDFs, documents, data)
- Enable capabilities like web browsing, DALL-E image generation, and code interpreter
- Create custom actions that connect to external APIs

### Discovery & Distribution
- Featured GPTs highlighted weekly by OpenAI editors
- Category-based browsing (Writing, Productivity, Research, Education, Lifestyle, Programming)
- Leaderboards showing trending and popular GPTs
- Direct sharing via links

### Revenue Program
OpenAI's GPT Builder Revenue Program shares revenue with creators based on user engagement. The program is currently in limited rollout for US-based builders.

## Categories

- **Writing**: Content creation, editing, copywriting assistants
- **Productivity**: Task management, automation, workflow tools
- **Research & Analysis**: Data analysis, academic research, fact-checking
- **Education**: Tutoring, learning aids, skill development
- **Lifestyle**: Health, fitness, cooking, travel planning
- **Programming**: Code generation, debugging, documentation

## Getting Started

1. Subscribe to ChatGPT Plus, Team, or Enterprise
2. Navigate to "Explore GPTs" and click "Create"
3. Use natural language to describe your GPT to the GPT Builder
4. Configure knowledge, capabilities, and actions
5. Test and refine your GPT
6. Publish to the GPT Store

pros: Access to multiple AI models (GPT-4, Claude, Gemini, Llama)
Two monetization paths: subscription revenue share and per-message pricing
Both no-code (Prompt Bots) and code (Server Bots) options
Free tier available for basic usage
Multi-bot chat feature for combining bot capabilities
cons: Creators must cover their own API costs for Server Bots
Revenue share details not fully transparent
content:
## Overview

Poe (Platform for Open Exploration) is Quora's AI platform launched in 2022 that positions itself as the "app store of conversational AI." It aggregates multiple AI models from OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Meta, and others, while hosting a marketplace of user-created bots.

## Bot Types

### Prompt Bots (No-Code)
- Created using natural language instructions
- Poe prepends your instructions to every user message
- No programming required
- Perfect for specialized assistants, tutors, and creative bots

### Server Bots (Code-Based)
- Configure webhook endpoints for custom backend logic
- Full control over bot behavior and data fetching
- Connect to external APIs and databases
- Requires hosting infrastructure

## Monetization Options

### Subscription Revenue Share
When your bot encourages a user to subscribe to Poe Premium, you receive a share of the subscription revenue.

### Price-Per-Message
Introduced in April 2024, creators can set a specific price in compute points for each message sent to their bot. This is essential for bots with significant API costs.

## Supported Models

Poe provides access to:
- **OpenAI**: GPT-4, GPT-4 Turbo, GPT-3.5
- **Anthropic**: Claude 3 Opus, Sonnet, Haiku
- **Google**: Gemini Pro
- **Meta**: Llama 2, Llama 3
- **Mistral**: Mistral Large, Medium, Small
- And many more specialized models

## 2025 Features

- **Poe Apps**: Interactive applications beyond chat
- **Multi-Bot Chat**: Combine multiple bots in one conversation
- **Enterprise Tier**: Coming for business deployments
- **Enhanced Analytics**: Detailed usage and revenue tracking

## Getting Started

1. Create a free Poe account
2. Navigate to Creator Portal
3. Choose Prompt Bot or Server Bot
4. Configure your bot's instructions and capabilities
5. Set monetization options
6. Publish to the bot marketplace

pros: Einstein Trust Layer for AI safety
Deep CRM and business data integration
content:
## Overview

AgentExchange is Salesforce's dedicated marketplace for AI agents built on the Agentforce platform. Launched as an evolution of AppExchange for the agentic AI era, it provides a trusted hub for enterprises to discover, evaluate, and deploy pre-built AI agent solutions.

## AgentExchange Components

### Actions
Expand agent capabilities with:
- Custom integrations (Apex, Flows, APIs)
- External service connections
- Data retrieval and manipulation
- Process automation

### Prompt Templates
Pre-written guides for consistent agent behavior:
- Response formatting
- Task-specific instructions
- Brand voice guidelines
- Compliance requirements

### Topics
Focus agent behavior on specific tasks:
- Scope definition
- Guardrail configuration
- Capability boundaries
- Performance optimization

### Agent Templates
Complete AI solutions including:
- Pre-configured topics
- Bundled actions
- Ready-to-deploy agents
- Industry-specific solutions

## Einstein Trust Layer

All agents operate within Salesforce's Einstein Trust Layer:
- **Dynamic Grounding**: Real-time data context
- **Zero Data Retention**: No customer data stored by LLMs
- **Toxicity Detection**: Content safety filtering
- **Audit Trails**: Complete action logging
- **Data Masking**: Sensitive information protection

## Launch Partners

200+ partners including:
- Technology integrators
- ISV partners
- System integrators
- Consulting firms

Over 1,000 partners trained to build AI agents.

## Agentforce Platform

### Agent Builder
Create agents using:
- Low-code/no-code tools
- Natural language instructions
- Pre-built templates
- Custom development

### Agent Capabilities
- **Sales Agents**: Lead qualification, opportunity management
- **Service Agents**: Case resolution, customer support
- **Marketing Agents**: Campaign optimization, personalization
- **Commerce Agents**: Product recommendations, order management

### Multi-Cloud Support
Agents work across:
- Sales Cloud
- Service Cloud
- Marketing Cloud
- Commerce Cloud
- Platform

## Security & Compliance

Enterprise-grade requirements:
- Salesforce security review
- SOC 2 compliance
- GDPR compatibility
- Industry-specific certifications
- Penetration testing

## Getting Started

1. Join Salesforce Partner Program
2. Complete Agentforce training
3. Build and test your agent/component
4. Submit for security review
5. Publish to AgentExchange
6. Market to Salesforce customers

pros: Shopify handles billing via App Billing API
cons: 2025 change: $1M threshold is now lifetime, not annual
content:
## Overview

Shopify App Store is the leading e-commerce app marketplace, serving millions of merchants with over 10,000 apps. In 2025, Shopify changed their revenue share policy from annual to lifetime thresholds.

## 2025 Revenue Share Changes

**Important:** As of 2025, the $1M commission-free threshold is now **lifetime**, not annual:
- First $1M lifetime revenue: 0% commission
- After $1M lifetime: 15% (or 20% without $19 registration)
- All transactions: 2.9% processing fee

### Impact
- Small developers (<$1M total): No change
- Larger developers: Pay commission on full revenue after exceeding lifetime threshold

## App Billing API

Shopify handles billing through their API:
- Recurring charges (subscriptions)
- One-time charges
- Usage-based charges
- Automatic merchant invoicing

Strong enterprise security (zero data retention for LLM training)
Real-time search API and MCP server support
cons: Requires Slack Pro or Enterprise for some features
Competitive space with many established apps
content:
## Overview

The Slack AI Apps marketplace is a dedicated category within the Slack App Directory featuring AI-powered applications. With 13%+ of all Slack apps now being AI-powered, this category has become a key focus area, with major AI companies building native Slack integrations.

## Major AI Partners

Leading AI companies with Slack apps:
- **Anthropic**: Claude integration for AI assistance
- **Google**: Gemini-powered features
- **Perplexity**: AI search and research
- **Writer**: Custom AI apps and content generation
- **Dropbox**: AI-powered document intelligence
- **Notion**: Connected workspace AI
- **Cognition Labs**: Devin AI developer assistant
- **Vercel**: AI-powered deployment assistance
- **Cursor**: AI coding assistant

## Featured AI Apps

### Productivity & Content
- **Asana**: AI-powered project insights and recommendations
- **Writer**: On-brand content generation and AI apps
- **Glean**: Internal knowledge search and AI answers

### Research & Intelligence
- **Perplexity**: Web search with citable insights
- **Guru**: AI-powered knowledge management

### Development
- **Cursor**: AI coding assistance in Slack
- **Vercel**: Deployment and preview automation

## Platform Capabilities

### Real-Time Search API
Developers can access:
- Slack conversation data (with permissions)
- Channel context for AI responses
- Thread history for continuity

### MCP Server Support
Model Context Protocol integration allows:
- Flexible, secure data access
- Third-party AI model connections
- Custom tool integrations

## Security & Privacy

Slack enforces strict AI data policies:
- **Zero Copy**: No customer data copied to third parties
- **Zero LLM Training**: Customer data never used to train models
- All apps reviewed against submission guidelines

## Building AI Apps for Slack

### Slack Platform Features
- Workflow Builder for no-code automation
- Bolt SDK for custom development
- Socket Mode for real-time connections
- Block Kit for rich UI components

### AI-Specific Tools
- AI app templates and examples
- Context-aware data access
- Enterprise-grade authentication

## Use Cases

- **Customer Support**: AI-powered ticket triage and response drafting
- **Sales**: Lead research and prospect intelligence
- **Engineering**: Code review assistance and documentation
- **HR**: Policy questions and onboarding assistance
- **Marketing**: Content ideation and competitive research

tagline: AI agents that automate work across 8,000+ apps

commissionTiers.conditions: Usage counts against Zapier plan task limits

submission.guidelinesSummary: Agents are built on Zapier's platform using connected apps. No separate marketplace submission required.

seo.metaDescription: Build AI agents that automate work across 8,000+ apps. Create AI teammates for lead research, customer support, and complex workflow automation.

pros: Tool Bundle Sharing for team collaboration
cons: Usage counts against Zapier task limits
Premium plans required for advanced features
content:
## Overview

Zapier Agents are AI-powered teammates that go beyond traditional chatbots by working autonomously across 8,000+ connected applications. Unlike chat-based agents that only respond when prompted, Zapier Agents proactively monitor for triggers and take action automatically.

## Agent Capabilities

### Autonomous Operation
Agents can:
- Monitor triggers across connected apps
- Make decisions based on context
- Execute multi-step workflows
- Operate 24/7 without prompting

### App Ecosystem
Access to 8,000+ integrations including:
- CRM systems (Salesforce, HubSpot)
- Communication (Slack, Email, SMS)
- Productivity (Google Workspace, Notion)
- Marketing (Mailchimp, LinkedIn)
- Development (GitHub, Jira)
- And thousands more

## Agent Types

### Lead Research Agent
- Automatically research new leads
- Enrich contact information
- Score and qualify prospects
- Sync to CRM

### IT Helpdesk Agent
- Monitor Slack channels for questions
- Provide timely responses
- Escalate complex issues
- Track resolution metrics

### Customer Support Agent
- Draft replies using knowledge base
- Handle routine inquiries
- Route to human agents as needed
- Update ticket status

### Research Agent
- Compile information from multiple sources
- Summarize findings
- Generate reports
- Stay current on topics

## 2025 Features

### Version Management
- Draft and published versions (beta)
- Rollback to previous working versions
- Safe testing before deployment

### Tool Bundle Sharing
- Create tool bundles once
- Share via link with teammates
- Each user connects own accounts
- Credentials stay private

### MCP Support
Model Context Protocol integration for:
- Extended capabilities
- Custom tool connections
- External service integration

## Creating Agents

### No-Code Builder
1. Describe what you want the agent to do
2. Connect relevant apps and data sources
3. Define triggers and conditions
4. Set oversight level (autonomous vs. approval-required)
5. Test and refine
6. Deploy

### Customization Options
- Custom instructions and personality
- Knowledge base connections
- Approval workflows
- Human-in-the-loop checkpoints

## Pricing

Zapier Agents usage counts against plan task limits:
- **Free**: Limited tasks included
- **Starter**: $19.99/month (basic agents)
- **Professional**: $49/month (advanced features)
- **Team**: $69/month (collaboration features)
- **Enterprise**: Custom pricing

## Human Oversight

Control automation levels:
- **Full Autonomy**: Agent acts independently
- **Approval Required**: Human approves actions
- **Suggestion Mode**: Agent recommends, human executes
- **Custom Rules**: Define specific oversight triggers

content:
## Overview

Zapier is the world's largest automation platform, connecting 8,000+ applications to help businesses automate workflows without code. Started in 2011 with just 34 app integrations, it has grown to serve 3.4 million companies and has processed 81 billion automation tasks.

## Key Statistics

- **8,000+ integrations** (up from 5,000 in 2022)
- **3.4 million companies** using the platform
- **81 billion tasks** processed to date
- **30,000+ ready-to-run actions** across integrations
- **147 integration updates** in a single month (early 2024)

## Developer Platform

### Building Integrations
- CLI-based development tools
- JavaScript-based integration code
- Visual builder for simple integrations
- Comprehensive documentation

### Integration Components
- **Triggers**: Events that start automations
- **Actions**: Tasks performed when triggered
- **Searches**: Data lookup operations

## Partner Program

Benefits for verified partners:
- Featured placement in directory
- Co-marketing opportunities
- Dedicated partner support
- Integration analytics and insights
- Access to partner resources

## MCP Integration

Zapier offers MCP (Model Context Protocol) integration:
- Connect AI tools to 8,000+ apps
- Enable AI agents to perform actions
- No-code automation for AI workflows

commissionTiers.conditions: Zoho takes 30% of paid extension sales

fees.reducedCommissionDetails: Free extensions have no fees. Paid extensions follow 70/30 revenue split.

submission.guidelinesSummary: Extensions must follow Zoho's quality guidelines, security requirements, and provide clear value to users.

seo.metaDescription: Build extensions for 29 Zoho products. 2,500+ extensions reaching 100,000+ business users.

content:
## Overview

Zoho Marketplace is the official extension platform for Zoho's comprehensive business software suite. With 2,500+ extensions as of early 2025, it has grown significantly from the 1,000+ milestone celebrated in 2024.

## Key Statistics

- **2,500+ extensions** available (2025)
- **30,000+ monthly installations**
- **100,000+ business users** reached globally
- **374,000+ total installations**
- **29 Zoho products** supported
- **40+ business categories**

## Supported Products

- Zoho CRM
- Zoho Desk
- Zoho Books
- Zoho Projects
- Zoho Creator
- Zoho Analytics
- Zoho Mail
- Zoho People
- And 21+ more products

## Extension Types

- CRM automations
- Workflow integrations
- Data connectors
- Reporting tools
- Communication bridges
- Industry-specific solutions

## Development

Build extensions using:
- Zoho Developer Console
- Deluge scripting language
- REST APIs
- Widgets and custom UI
- Webhooks

name: Zoom App Marketplace
description: Zoom App Marketplace is the official platform for apps and integrations that extend Zoom's video communications platform. With 2,700+ apps and over 6 million installs, it's essential for developers building productivity and collaboration tools.

commissionTiers.conditions: Zoom does not charge commission on app listings

fees.reducedCommissionDetails: Zoom App Marketplace is free to list on. Developers handle their own monetization outside of Zoom's platform.

submission.guidelinesSummary: Apps must meet Zoom's security, privacy, and functionality requirements. Review includes security assessment and compliance verification.

seo.metaTitle: Zoom App Marketplace - Video Communications Apps
seo.metaDescription: Build apps for Zoom's 300M+ users. 2,700+ apps available with no commission fees.

pros: Growing AI app ecosystem (19% of listings)
content:
## Overview

Zoom App Marketplace launched in October 2018 and has grown from 200 apps to over 2,700 apps and integrations. It supports apps for Zoom Meetings, Webinars, Rooms, Phone, and Team Chat.

## Key Statistics

- **2,700+ apps** and integrations
- **6M+ app installs** total
- **650% growth** in apps since 2020
- **19% AI-powered apps** (growing category)
- **300M+ daily meeting participants**

## App Types

### Zoom Apps
- Run inside Zoom client
- Access to Zoom Apps SDK
- In-meeting experiences

### Integrations
- API-based connections
- Webhook notifications
- OAuth authentication

### Chatbots
- Team Chat integrations
- Automated workflows
- Command-based interactions

## Growth Timeline

- October 2018: Marketplace launched
- 2020: 200 apps available
- July 2021: 1,000+ apps
- 2024: 2,500+ apps
- 2025: 2,700+ apps (19% AI-powered)

name: Zuora Connect Marketplace
description: Zuora Connect Marketplace is the official app marketplace for Zuora's subscription management platform. With 150+ pre-built applications, it extends Zuora with quoting, financial operations, data ingestion, e-signatures, and ERP integrations for subscription businesses.

metrics.appCountSource: Zuora (estimated 150+ apps including 100+ apps in 2017 plus growth)

commissionTiers.conditions: Zuora does not charge commission on marketplace apps

fees.reducedCommissionDetails: Partners maintain their own pricing. Zuora Connect enables app distribution.

submission.guidelinesSummary: Apps must integrate with Zuora Central platform and provide value for subscription businesses.

seo.metaTitle: Zuora Connect Marketplace - Subscription Economy Apps
seo.metaDescription: Build apps for Zuora. 150+ pre-built applications for subscription businesses.

content:
## Overview

Zuora Connect Marketplace is the official app marketplace for Zuora's subscription management platform. With 150+ pre-built applications, extensions, and integrations, it helps subscription businesses extend Zuora Central with specialized functionality.

## Key Statistics

- **150+ pre-built applications** (estimated)
- **100+ apps** at marketplace expansion (2017)
- Enterprise subscription platform
- Acquired by Silver Lake/GIC for $1.7B (Feb 2025)

## App Categories

- Quoting & CPQ
- Financial operations
- Data ingestion
- E-signatures
- ERP integrations
- Revenue recognition

## Notable Integrations

- Salesforce CPQ
- NetSuite
- DocuSign
- Avalara
- Togai (acquired by Zuora May 2024)

## Platform Features

- Pre-built applications
- Custom extensions
- Interface tools
- Technology partner ecosystem
- Developer center

## Development

Build apps using:
- Zuora REST APIs
- Zuora Central Platform
- Developer documentation
- Partner program
- Zuora Connect SDK
